title: I can't synchronize new ETH blocks after the update.
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `2021.09.1-alpha` (it doesn't match with the release version on GitHub)

OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour

I had to upgrade erigon after the bug found by the Go Ethereum team. My node was one of the affected ones and I could not synchronize new blocks anymore.

I upgraded the erigon's version running the commands 

```bash
git clone --recurse-submodules -j8 https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon.git
cd erigon
make erigon
./build/bin/erigon
```

Erigon started correctly and it downloaded missing blocks. It went through the steps and once it reached step number 14/18, it logged that there was an error with the block `13139709`.
It started again with step number 1 and these are the logs I've been seeing for a day:

```
INFO[09-01|14:56:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="418.40 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|14:56:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="469.40 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|14:57:21.811] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=26 eth65=30
WARN[09-01|14:57:27.694] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140050
INFO[09-01|14:57:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="331.91 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|14:57:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="415.29 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|14:58:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="441.38 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
WARN[09-01|14:58:38.210] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13139864
INFO[09-01|14:58:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="473.14 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|14:59:21.812] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=27 eth65=28
INFO[09-01|14:59:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="332.56 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
WARN[09-01|14:59:43.212] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140255
INFO[09-01|14:59:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="408.32 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:00:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="435.39 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
WARN[09-01|15:00:33.205] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140258
INFO[09-01|15:00:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="474.16 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:01:21.811] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=27 eth65=28
WARN[09-01|15:01:28.069] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140263
INFO[09-01|15:01:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="335.70 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:01:59.203] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="377.35 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
WARN[09-01|15:02:18.484] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140267
INFO[09-01|15:02:29.203] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="416.05 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:02:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="468.44 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
WARN[09-01|15:03:10.425] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140275
INFO[09-01|15:03:21.812] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=27 eth65=27
INFO[09-01|15:03:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="334.20 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:03:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="400.92 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
WARN[09-01|15:04:02.205] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140360
INFO[09-01|15:04:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="456.08 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:04:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="527.10 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:05:21.811] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=27 eth65=28
WARN[09-01|15:05:22.033] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140279
INFO[09-01|15:05:29.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="338.13 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:05:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="382.91 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
WARN[09-01|15:06:22.316] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140282
INFO[09-01|15:06:29.203] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="413.34 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
INFO[09-01|15:06:59.204] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13139709 blk/second=0.000 alloc="489.14 MiB" sys="4.30 GiB"
```

It's stuck there and I don't know what I did wrong. I tried to restart it but I got the same result.

Can someone help me with this issue?
It's the same issue of #2611 . When I opened it, since I launched the erigon process using `screen`, I could not get old logs.
Did you also get invalid state root hash?

I got the error `Wrong trie root of block 13140584`.

I launched erigon and these are the logs:

```bash 
EROR[09-01|19:17:36.481] [11/18 IntermediateHashes] Wrong trie root of block 13140584: b637aa5b7b962bd0e1800e20d0006c34151c18ea6f2181173731fe0ee5d50583, expected (from header): 734f83635acdf9d21811a155fa534f915beb2c7f6272223a1073ac639cc4171f. Block hash: d9d4ebab8530b086db5371e8008fc977aa7a04f62f9740042a305615bc78c2d5 
WARN[09-01|19:17:36.481] Unwinding due to incorrect root hash     to=13140583
INFO[09-01|19:17:36.481] UnwindTo                                 block=13140583 bad_block_hash=0xd9d4ebab8530b086db5371e8008fc977aa7a04f62f9740042a305615bc78c2d5
INFO[09-01|19:17:36.482] [11/18 IntermediateHashes] DONE          in=1h4m10.210570867s
INFO[09-01|19:17:36.482] [10/18 HashState] Unwinding started      from=13140584 to=13140583 storage=false codes=true
INFO[09-01|19:17:36.838] [10/18 HashState] Unwinding started      from=13140584 to=13140583 storage=false codes=false
INFO[09-01|19:17:37.465] [10/18 HashState] Unwinding started      from=13140584 to=13140583 storage=true codes=false
INFO[09-01|19:17:38.231] [7/18 Execution] Unwind Execution        from=13140584 to=13140583
INFO[09-01|19:19:34.768] [1/18 Headers] Unwind done               in=2021-09-01T19:17:40+0000
INFO[09-01|19:19:34.768] [1/18 Headers] Waiting for headers...    from=13140583
INFO[09-01|19:19:36.138] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=27 eth65=31
INFO[09-01|19:20:04.769] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13140583 blk/second=0.000 alloc="873.71 MiB" sys="5.65 GiB"
WARN[09-01|19:20:19.448] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140586
WARN[09-01|19:20:19.448] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140589
WARN[09-01|19:20:19.448] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140593
WARN[09-01|19:20:19.448] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140600
WARN[09-01|19:20:19.449] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140624
WARN[09-01|19:20:19.449] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140674
INFO[09-01|19:20:34.769] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13140583 blk/second=0.000 alloc="479.41 MiB" sys="5.65 GiB"
INFO[09-01|19:21:04.769] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=13140583 blk/second=0.000 alloc="529.45 MiB" sys="5.65 GiB"
WARN[09-01|19:21:12.774] Invalidating anchor for suspected unavailability height=13140639
```
@fedecastelli Can you please try to run from current `devel` branch? I have just merged the fix for the similar problem on Ropsten, it should help you get unstuck

@AlexeyAkhunov I run the current `devel` branch but now I'm stuck here:

```bash
EROR[09-02|13:51:58.341] [11/18 IntermediateHashes] Wrong trie root of block 13117001: 6df04940981b23438b8e489f54b689a66ef74a26b83280a5e86dfd9fd7dcb5f1, expected (from header): c2e488cad3345b1cac7a582a2be6bc05feaaeb63d0d81f5baa14dfee0b4f4c42. Block hash: 150082ce02412310fd9ec093a0d2d24035c2c9e9129c8349cc04457b377c3ff5
WARN[09-02|13:51:58.341] Unwinding due to incorrect root hash     to=13112259
INFO[09-02|13:51:58.341] UnwindTo                                 block=13112259 bad_block_hash=0x150082ce02412310fd9ec093a0d2d24035c2c9e9129c8349cc04457b377c3ff5
INFO[09-02|13:51:58.341] [11/18 IntermediateHashes] DONE          in=32m47.002930704s
INFO[09-02|13:51:58.342] [10/18 HashState] Unwinding started      from=13117001 to=13112259 storage=false codes=true
INFO[09-02|13:52:21.696] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=32 eth65=32
INFO[09-02|13:52:28.343] [10/18 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting   from=AccountChangeSet progress=0 alloc="474.30 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:53:02.952] [10/18 HashState] Unwinding started      from=13117001 to=13112259 storage=false codes=false
INFO[09-02|13:53:37.537] [10/18 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading      into=HashedAccount progress=56 alloc="461.25 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:54:07.534] [10/18 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading      into=HashedAccount progress=63 alloc="551.05 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:54:21.696] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=32 eth65=32
INFO[09-02|13:54:37.534] [10/18 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading      into=HashedAccount progress=89 alloc="656.31 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:54:42.506] [10/18 HashState] Unwinding started      from=13117001 to=13112259 storage=true codes=false
INFO[09-02|13:55:12.508] [10/18 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting   from=StorageChangeSet progress=0 alloc="650.01 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:55:42.511] [10/18 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting   from=StorageChangeSet progress=0 alloc="676.34 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:56:21.696] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=32 eth65=32
INFO[09-02|13:56:27.257] [10/18 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading      into=HashedStorage progress=53 alloc="919.07 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:56:57.255] [10/18 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading      into=HashedStorage progress=53 alloc="1017.18 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:57:27.257] [10/18 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading      into=HashedStorage progress=53 alloc="1.08 GiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
INFO[09-02|13:57:57.255] [10/18 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading      into=HashedStorage progress=56 alloc="756.18 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"

INFO[09-02|13:58:27.255] [10/18 HashState] ETL [2/2] Loading      into=HashedStorage progress=63 alloc="844.34 MiB" sys="5.17 GiB"
```

do I have to wait for the process to unwind all the incorrect blocks?

@AlexeyAkhunov all is good now, thank you! 

Sorry for the late reply but I was running my internal processes to see if they were running correctly too.
